title: Toy Story 4's Forky is starring in his own show on Disney+
text:
He's a homemade toy with pipe cleaner arms and mismatched googly eyes.

But Forky has proven that even with humble beginnings, the sky is the limit.

Pixar has placed the underdog character in the starring role of Forky Asks A Question, a new original series featured on Disney's streaming service Disney+.

Coming soon: Pixar has placed the underdog character Forky in the starring role of Forky Asks A Question, a new original series featured on Disney's streaming service Disney+

The series is a collection of 10 shorts where Forky explores life's biggest questions, such as 'What is love?' and 'What is time?'

'What is a friend?' and 'What is art?' also make appearances in the trailer.

At one point during the trailer for the series, Forky consults with Rex on defining the concept of time.

Just asking: The series is a collection of 10 shorts where Forky explores life's biggest questions, such as 'What is love?' and 'What is time?'

'Time can be future or past,' Rex replies - sending Forky into a tizzy. 'Whoaaaa!' Forky says back.

Actor Tony Hale of Arrested Development fame lends his voice to the character in Toy Story 4.

He opened up to Variety in June about how he relates to his character's persona as well as the importance of the utensil he portrays.

Deep: 'Time can be future or past,' Rex replies - sending Forky into a tizzy. 'Whoaaaa!' Forky says back

When asked about how he prepared to play Forky, Hale replied: 'I will say, I’ve become quite an advocate for sporks.

'They are a very underrated utensil. It’s like the unicorn of utensils, they need a lot more attention. It has a really great purpose.

'It’s great for a nice thick minestrone soup. It’s just not getting the attention it deserves. It’s the best of both worlds.'

Disney+ launches on Nov. 12.
description: He's a homemade toy with pipe cleaner arms and mismatched googly eyes. But Forky has proven that even with humble beginnings, the sky is the limit.
